stanza.line: Whoever hath her wish thou hast thy willwill
And Will to boot and Will in over-plusover-plus
More than enough am I that vex thee stillstill
To thy sweet will making addition thusthus
Wilt thou whose will is large and spaciousspacious
Not once vouchsafe to hide my will in thinethine
Shall will in others seem right graciousgracious
And in my will no fair acceptance shineshine
The sea all water yet receives rain stillstill
And in abundance addeth to his storestore
So thou being rich in will add to thy willwill
One will of mine to make thy large will moremore
Let no unkind no fair beseechers killkill
Think all but one and me in that one WillWill
